question.text:
Given below are two statements:
Statement I : The identification of Ni2+ is carried out by dimethyl glyoxime in the presence of NH4OH.

Statement II :The dimethyl glyoxime is a bidentate neutral ligand.

In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:

options.text: Statement <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></math> is false but Statement <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>II</mi></math> is true.
Statement <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></math> is true but Statement <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>II</mi></math> is false.
Both Statement <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></math> and Statement <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>II</mi></math> are true.
Both Statement <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></math> and Statement <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>II</mi></math> are false.

solution.text:
Neutral dimethyl glyoxime does not act as ligand.

When Ni2+ reacts with dimethyl glyoxime in presence of NH4OH, it produce dimethyl glyoximate then it form rozy red ppt.

Niaq2++2dmg-→Nidmg2Rosy red ppt.

data.bucket: Must Do Ques (JEE Main) - Any Difficulty
